snippet.title: Fire and Darkness gameplay
snippet.description:
Fire and Darkness is a three-dimensional real-time strategy video game developed by Singularity Software. It's design started in 1996 and lasted for three years, with developers working mostly on summer. It became the first game to the Seumas McNally Grand Prize at the Independent Games Festival of 1999.

This is the original demo avaiable on now-defunct Singularity Software's website. You can't play in the demo, but it offers a live gameplay demonstration, along with an explanation of the units in the game, and maps (or planets) where you could play in the final version.

Sadly, this game was never finished.
